title: Covid: Global healthcare workers missing out on jabs
description: Campaigners say millions have not had even one vaccine dose, raising concerns for their communities.

title: How to cool your home in a warming world
description: Low-energy designs and technologies can keep homes comfortable, come rain or shine.

title: Olympics: Defying threats, Iranian athletes speak out to back ban
description: Olympics organisers are being urged to investigate allegations of threats, discrimination and abuse.

title: Protesting India farmers brave cold, heat and Covid
description: Seven months on, farmers are still striking against contentious new laws outside the national capital.

title: Pegasus: Spyware sold to governments 'targets activists'
description: Israeli tech firm NSO denies media reports that its software has been sold to authoritarian regimes.

title: Olympics: Eight self-isolating from Team GB
description: Two South Africa footballers test positive for Covid-19 in Olympic village, while eight Team GB athletes and staff isolating as close contacts.

title: Covid: Home-education numbers rise by 75%
description: "Covid anxiety" is among the explanations for the increasing popularity of out-of-school teaching.

title: Covid: Restrictions ease as Scotland moves to level zero
description: The whole of Scotland has now moved to the lowest level of Covid regulations.

title: Horse racing: Thousands of racehorses killed in slaughterhouses
description: Some horses once trained by some of racing’s top names are being slaughtered, BBC Panorama finds.

title: Using plastic waste to help solve sand shortages
description: With construction sand in short supply crushed plastic is being used as an alternative.

title: Covid: Face mask rules relax but what do workers think?
description: It is no longer a legal requirement to wear a face covering in England, but some employees are nervous.

title: Why I've hosted more than 30 refugees in my house
description: Karina Litvack has housed dozens of refugees in London since her daughters moved out.

title: Covid: 'The shift to online has been life-changing'
description: Jase Puddicombe, 27, says the rise of digital services has improved access for disabled people.

title: Lex Gillette: Record-breaking blind long jumper
description: With the support of his sighted guide, the four-time Paralympic medallist hopes to win gold in Tokyo.

title: Thousands of orders cancelled after Ocado robot fire
description: The online grocer says the blaze was caused by a collision between robots at one of its warehouses.

title: Cavendish feels he is 'getting younger' after cementing status as Tour great
description: How Mark Cavendish rode into Tour de France history to share the stage win record with Eddy Merckx and to win the green jersey.

title: Verstappen brands Hamilton 'disrespectful' after British GP crash
description: Max Verstappen accuses Lewis Hamilton of being "disrespectful" and "unsportsmanlike" following their crash in the British Grand Prix.

title: The Open 2021: Morikawa's bogey-free final round seals victory on Open debut
description: American debutant Collin Morikawa shoots a bogey-free final round to finish top of the Open leader board and claim the Claret Jug at Royal St George's.

title: England should be favourites for T20 World Cup - Vaughan
description: England "have got absolutely everything covered" before the T20 World Cup this year, says former captain Michael Vaughan.

title: Morikawa holds off Spieth to win Claret Jug on Open debut - report & highlights
description: Collin Morikawa shoots a scintillating bogey-free final round to win the 149th Open Championship by two shots from Jordan Spieth at Royal St George's.

title: Oil producing nations agree deal to control prices
description: The Opec cartel and Russia will boost supply which should see petrol prices at the pumps come down.

title: England v Pakistan T20: Rizwan caught and bowled by Rashid
description: Adil Rashid dives to his left to take a superb one-handed catch of his own bowling during England's second T20 match of the series against Pakistan.

title: England v Pakistan T20: Liam Livingstone smashes six out of Headingley - twice!
description: Liam Livingstone smashes two sixes out of Headingley as England face Pakistan in their second T20 match of the three-match series.

title: Europe floods: Residents return home to see damage inflicted
description: Resident in Kleivelderweg, deep inside the Dutch disaster zone, find homes and businesses destroyed.

title: World Student Games: Sheffield's forgotten sporting spectacle
description: Sheffield's decision to host the World Student Games in 1991 still divides opinions across the city.
